input_text:
Job Title: Implementation Consultant

Location: Tempe, AZ

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Customer Service, Human Resources, Information Technology

Description:
This is a hybrid role with 3 days in the office required, and 2 days of remote. Unlock Your Career Potential: Implementation at ADP. Do you have a passion for out-of-the-box thinking and a commitment to making sure customers get the most for their investments? Are you a self-motivated person able to work independently while maintaining control of your projects and workload? Are you a good communicator as well as quality-driven and attentive to details? Do you enjoy variety, technical challenges, and problem-solving? Then the Implementation Consultant position is perfect for a person like you! At ADP, the Implementation team is driven by our customers' success. With us, you'll combine your analytic and project management skills with your ability to simplify complex information -- helping customers develop the skills and confidence to use our products with ease. You provide the expert support that makes our integrated solutions stand out in an increasingly competitive global marketplace. 
ADP is hiring an Implementation Consultant I. In this position, you'll leverage our top-ranked training programs and world-class service guidelines, along with your business consulting expertise, to create exceptional onboarding experiences for each product or service implementation.
We strive for every interaction to be driven by our CORE values: Insightful Expertise, Integrity is Everything, Service Excellence, Inspiring Innovation, Each Person Counts, Results-Driven, and Social Responsibility.
RESPONSIBILITIES: Review the information and high-level requirements obtained during the sales cycle, then finalize details by interacting with client and vendor Subject Matter Experts. Use established best practices to design and document the solution and then configure and implement the solution.Act as primary contact and project owner accountable for a successful Industry Solutions (IDI) implementationDrive analysis process (phone calls, emails) to maintain a high degree of client engagementCollaborate with partner resources in TIME and Payroll to create the best design across all systems involved in the scope of the projectWrite a clear and complete Technical Design Document (TDD) that follows ADP best practicesConfigure a client-specific solution that meets best practices for reliability and supportabilityCreate well-designed test plans to fully validate the solution to ensure qualityCollaborate with partners and 3rd party vendors to unit test solutions before the client testing phaseWrite internal solution documentation to ensure ongoing supportTrain the customer users on how to interact with, maintain, and validate the Industry Solutions(IDI) solutionEnsure the client is executing a test plan and reviewing data to confirm expected resultsObtain client confirmation that they are comfortable with and confident in the solution results
QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED:At least 3 years of experience working in a client service/customer service environmentAt least 1 year of business consulting experience.SQL or Python preferred QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED TO SUCCEED IN THIS ROLE:
Proven ability to maintain focus and work effectively with multiple demandsAbility to work both independently to provide solutions to the client and as part of a team to accomplish tasksStrong client relationship skills including the ability to influence clients and guide them client to the best solution to help resolve their client needsAbility to communicate clearly and in a directive manner to obtain necessary information and requirements from the client, explain technical concepts in a way that can be understood by the client, establish what tasks need to be completed by whom and by when, and create credibility and fosters customer confidenceMust be comfortable working in a performance-based and structured environment while demonstrating high ethical standardsExperience with data retrieval, analysis, manipulation, and transformationExperience implementing and/or supporting enterprise-grade software solutions; preferably HCM applications (i.e. time & attendance, payroll, accounting, point of sales, or HR-related software applications)Experience with technical writing. This can include writing technical summaries of client issues, client-specific support documentation, technical specifications, user guides, or training documentation
 YOU'LL ALSO LOVE WORKING HERE BECAUSE YOU CAN:Belong by joining one of nine Business Resource Groups to connect globally with networks and allies who share common interests and experiences.Be your healthiest. Best-in-class benefits start on Day 1 because healthy associates are happy ones.Focus on your mental health and well-being. We're here to provide exceptional service to our clients, and none of that happens without each of us taking care of ourselves and being there for one another.Join a company committed to giving back and generating a lasting, positive impact on the communities in which we work and live.Get paid to pay it forward. Company-paid time off for volunteering for causes you care about.
What are you waiting for? Apply now!Jobs.adp.com

Experience Level (if available): Associate

output_json.title: Implementation Consultant
output_json.summary: A hybrid role requiring 3 days in the office and 2 days remote, focusing on customer success through ADP's products.
job_responsibilities: Finalize details with client and vendor
Act as primary contact and project owner
Ensure client execution of test plans
output_json.equal_opportunity_policy: We strive for every interaction to be driven by our CORE values: Insightful Expertise, Integrity is Everything, Service Excellence, Inspiring Innovation, Each Person Counts, Results-Driven, and Social Responsibility.
